newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portugal copper mine completely halted - union.
newsitem.headline: Portugal copper mine completely halted - union.

text.p: Output from the Neves Corvo copper mine in southern Portugal was completely halted as a strike over working hours went into its second day, a senior union official told Reuters.
"The production process is completely stopped," Antonio Banza, a director of the mining union said.
It was not immediately possible to contact company officials for reaction to the union leader's statement on output.
According to a report in financial daily Diario Economico, the company had enough stocks to guarantee commercial contracts for one week.
Unions, which are protesting at company plans to introduce seven-day shifts, have set no time limit for the stoppage at the 107,000 tonnes-per-year mine, Europe's largest.
But a delegation of workers planned to set out from the mine, some 250 km south of Lisbon, to try to secure a meeting with Somincor, the state-owned managing company, in the capital on Tuesday.
